video_title: Sleepy Head
description: Help your child nod off to sleep with this sweet baby lullaby. Time to get ready for bed and say goodnight? Bounce Patrol's soothing kids song

video_title: Best Nursery
description: These types of nursery rhymes for children help them to learn basic skills, know about environment birds and improves their ability to understand and prepare for future studies. Nursery rhymes and kid’s songs accelerate phonetic awareness improving children's word comprehension, reading and writing skills.

video_title: Fruits Song For Kids
description:
The Fruits Song For Kids is an engaging video that educates young kids about various fruits and its importance. Three kids go on a boat ride with their teacher as they are taught about the features of various fruits, such as fresh and crispy, tangy, and sweet.
The boat ride along the river with various fruits on the landscape gives a fun experience for the kids. The fruits song for kids displays images of the fruits on the board by engaging kids to guess their names based on their shape, color, and the animals that are fond of it. This Fruit Rhyme will keep your kids entertained while they learn about mango, banana, grapes, apple, and orange. Every minute will become an instant moment of joy with this Fruit Rhyme.

video_title: Numbers
description: 1...2...3… Skip the routine. We bring a spin to the boring countdown with the number rhymes for kids with fun animation and music that will force your young ones to tap their feet and count along. Sing along with this number songs for preschool and learn how to count. This number nursery rhymes make counting for kids so much easier.

video_title: Ants Go Marching One By One
description: The Ants go marching one by one song is one of the top 50 nursery songs right now! Want a fun, simple nursery rhyme to teach your children? All you have to do is play this video, made especially for kids with a catchy tune and eye-catching animation.

video_title: Bird
description: These types of bird rhymes for children help them to learn basic skills, know about environment birds and improves their ability to understand and prepare for future studies! Improving children's word comprehension, reading and writing skills.

video_title: Numbers
description: 1...2...3… Skip the routine. We bring a spin to the boring countdown with the number rhymes for kids with fun animation and music that will force your young ones to tap their feet and count along. Sing along with this number songs for preschool and learn how to count. This number nursery rhymes make counting for kids so much easier.

video_title: Vegetable
description: The Vegetable Rhyme is a favourite nursery rhyme for kids. This vegetable song helps kids learn about different types of vegetables. These veggie rhymes educate kids about the healthy and tasty qualities of various crunchy and munchy veggies we eat. This vegetable song for children lets them learn about big and small vegetables.

video_title: Shapes
description: This shape songs for toddlers starts by explaining the kids about what a triangle is - a shape with three straight lines meeting at three different points. Interesting, right? Then the shapes song for kids introduces us to Rectangle - a shape with four lines, two long and two short, that meet at right angles. Just like a mobile phone! Next in the shape song is the Circle - a shape with no sides and angles, and goes round and round and round! With the Shape rhymes for Nursery, point towards the next shape which is the twinkle twinkle shape in the sky - the star! The last but not the least comes the next shape in the shapes song lyrics, a shiny bright Diamond, which has a pointed bottom and a flat top.

video_title: The Colours
description: Colours song for children is a very dynamic kids songs as it talks about apples, balls, pumpkins, carrots, cheese, sun, grass, and frog. The colours song for kids is filled with happy and vibrant colours and happy dances by plums, flies and blueberries.

video_title: The Finger Family Song Nursery
description: The finger family song nursery rhyme is also famous for daddy finger song Want a fun, simple way to teach your children what the fingers on our hands are called? All you have to do is play this video, made especially for kids with a catchy tune and eye-catching animation.

video_title: Fruits Song
description:
The Fruits Song For Kids is an engaging video that educates young kids about various fruits and its importance. Three kids go on a boat ride with their teacher as they are taught about the features of various fruits, such as fresh and crispy, tangy, and sweet.
The boat ride along the river with various fruits on the landscape gives a fun experience for the kids. The fruits song for kids displays images of the fruits on the board by engaging kids to guess their names based on their shape, color, and the animals that are fond of it. This Fruit Rhyme will keep your kids entertained while they learn about mango, banana, grapes, apple, and orange. Every minute will become an instant moment of joy with this Fruit Rhyme.

video_title: Phonics
description: Let's make this phonetics rhyme time fun. Let us give you an example. A for Apple A for arrow Say with me aaa apple aaa arrow. That's the beauty of songs, isn't it? Sit with your parents, and enjoy the ABC song which has 26 letters. Let's get started!

video_title: Jungle
description: This is too much fun to see and learn animal names. So, what are you waiting for, enjoy this Bumcheek TV originals nursery rhymes.

video_title: Good Words
description: These magic words not only spread happiness around kids but also helps us to be better citizens by respecting each other no matter elder or younger, poor or rich. It is very important to inculcate these habits, especially in children as they are the future...

description: Breakfast is the most important meal of the day! Let’s sing along and see what delicious foods we can eat in the morning.

video_title: Good morning. Good bye
What time is it?
What day is it?
How's the weather? It's sunny.
Let's play soccer. I like baseball.
Happy Birthday - This is for you. Thanks.
Yours? Mine - Whose bike is this?
Sorry - Watch out!  Are you okay?
What - What's this? What's that?
Who - Who is he?
Where is it? - asking the way
In, On, Under - It is under the table.
How many - How many apples?
How much - How much is it?
How old - How old are you?
Like - Do you like milk?
At the table - Do you want some more?
Doing - What are you doing?
Did - What did you do yesterday?
Can - Can you swim?
Let's - Let's play soccer.
Put on - Put on your coat.
Do~/Don't~ - Imperative sentence.
What a wonderful team!
Number song - 123 - One two three
Body song - The Hokey Pokey.
Halloween - Trick or Treat.
Animal song - Five Little Ducks - Baa Baa Black Sheep.
Sports song - I like baseball
Weather song - How's the weather.
Birthday song - Happy Birthday!
Transportation song - car bus taxi.
Greeting song - Hi. Hello. How are you?
Color song - red yellow blue
Dance song - The Hokey Pokey

description: Toys Vocabulary Chant by ELF Learning

video_title: The perfect thing - The Storytellers
description: Are your children learning English? Watch a story with them and help them learn with our 'just for kids' series The Storytellers!

video_title: The best job in the world - The Storytellers
description: What do your children want to be when they grow up? What do they think is the best job in the world? Elli thinks she knows! Watch this story with them and help them learn English with our 'just for kids' series The Storytellers!

video_title: Little Monsters - The Storytellers
description: Do you love your 'little monsters'? Then help your children learn English by watching and studying with them through our 'just for kids' series The Storytellers!

video_title: Nell's book - The Storytellers
description: Do your children like reading? This episode of The Storytellers is all about Nell's book! Watch the story with them and help them study English in our 'just for kids' series.

video_title: Milly and the Rainbow - The Storytellers
description: Are your kids stuck at home at the moment? How about a story that teaches them English? Watch it with them and help them learn!

video_title: Joe goes fishing - the Storytellers
description: Are you stuck for something to do with the children? How about you all watch a story together and learn some English?

video_title: Abdu in the traffic jam - The Storytellers
description: Are your children learning English? Why not watch a story with them and help them learn with our 'just for kids' series The Storytellers!

video_title: Back to school - The Storytellers
description: Bella has her first day in school but needs some help from her big brother, Joe!

video_title: Sick day - The Storytellers
description: Bella has a sick day but should Joe also have a day off? Watch to find out!

video_title: Camping - The Storytellers
description: Bella goes on her first camping trip and Joe gets a fright!

video_title: Rainy day - The Storytellers
description: A rainy day spoils Bella and Joe's plans for the day so they have to make their own fun.

video_title: Football match - The Storytellers
description: Bella helps her big brother, Joe, make the most of a golden opportunity!

video_title: Exam time - The Storytellers
description: Joe struggles in his exam but gets a little help from his sister, Bella, and a magic pencil!

video_title: Shopping trip - The Storytellers
description: Bella and Joe's family go on a shopping trip‚ but Bella goes missing! Where could she be?

video_title: School trip - The Storytellers
description: Joe goes onto a school trip to the zoo ‚ but things don't go quite as planned!

video_title: No pets here - The Storytellers
description: Bella and Joe want to get a pet but will their parents let them? Watch to find out!

video_title: Car journey - The Storytellers
description: Bella and Joe go on a car journey and get lost on the way! Can Bella help them find their way?

video_title: Reading - Intermediate English with Mark #1
description: Mark does a reading activity that also focuses on the usage of the three main auxiliary verbs in English.

video_title: Listening - Intermediate English with Mark #2
description: Mark describes the different classes available in Smrt LIve Class. Then, he does a listening activity with the students in the chat.

video_title: Vocabulary - Intermediate English with Mark #3
description: Mark teaches English vocabulary about health and sickness.

video_title: Auxiliary Verbs - Intermediate English with Mark #4
description: Mark describes the different kind of verbs in English, modal verbs, and the three main auxiliary verbs: "be", "do", and "have".

video_title: Vocabulary & Making Questions  - Intermediate English with Mark #5
description: First, Mark does a vocabulary dictation activity to practice vocabulary studied two lessons before. Then, Mark gives a lesson on how to make subject and object questions in English.

video_title: Have & Have Got - Intermediate English with Mark #6
Auxiliary Verbs & Making Questions - Intermediate English with Mark #7
description: Mark reviews the rules about English auxiliary verbs, and the usage of inversion to make English questions.

video_title: Vocabulary - Intermediate English with Mark #8
description: Mark goes over the vocabulary list related to the topic of housing.

video_title: Present Simple & Continuous - Intermediate English with Mark #9
description: Mark explains the differences between the Present Simple and Present Continuous tenses.

video_title: State & Dynamic Verbs - Intermediate English with Mark #10
description: In this grammar lesson, Mark introduces the idea of state and dynamic verbs. State verbs are rarely used in the continuous tenses. The grammar lesson begins at 1:37 of the video.

video_title: Present Passive - Intermediate English with Mark #11
description: Mark explains how to use the passive voice with the Present Simple and Present Continuous tenses. The grammar lesson begins at 11:40 of the video.

video_title: Vocabulary + Past Simple & Continuous - Intermediate English with Mark #12
description: Mark explains some vocabulary and the differences between the Past Simple and Past Continuous tenses. The vocabulary lesson starts at 8:44. The grammar lesson begins at 38:21.

video_title: Vocabulary & Simple Sentences - Intermediate English with Mark #13
description: Mark describes some English vocabulary words and then introduces the rules for writing simple English sentences. At the end of the lesson, Mark starts discussing the idea of compound sentences. The vocabulary lesson begins at 4:57 of the video. The writing lesson begins at 43:03.

video_title: Vocabulary & Compound Sentences  - Intermediate English with Mark #14
description: Mark continues discussing vocabulary words in Unit Three and then explains how to write compound sentences in English. The vocabulary lesson starts at 20:51 of the video. The writing lesson starts at 38:42.

video_title: Past Perfect #1 - Intermediate English with Mark #15
description: Mark reviews the Past Simple and Continuous tenses and then introduces the rules for using the Past Perfect tense. The grammar lesson begins at 19:26 of the video.

video_title: Past Perfect #2 - Intermediate English with Mark #16
description: Mark continues discussing the past simple, past continuous, and past perfect tenses. The grammar lesson begins at 22:47.

video_title: Reading & Past Passive - Intermediate English with Mark #17
description: Mark reviews the past simple, past continuous, and past perfect tenses by doing a reading exercise. The review of past tenses and reading starts at 11:20. The lesson about past passive begins at 1:05:02.

video_title: Vocabulary & Listening - Intermediate English with Mark #18
description: In this class, we do a vocabulary dictation listening activity introducing a new unit's vocabulary list along with grammar we will study in the next lesson. The vocabulary listening activity begins at 2:52 of the video.

video_title: Listening & Modal Verbs - Intermediate English with Mark #19
description: Mark does a listening activity that introduces the topic of modal verbs. Then, Mark gives a lesson about modals and modal verbs of necessity. The listening activity begins at 7:59. The grammar lesson begins at 41:45.

video_title: Vocabulary & Modal Verbs - Intermediate English with Mark #20
description: Mark discusses more vocabulary words as well as continues the lesson from class #19 about modal verbs. Specifically, Mark discusses how to use "have to", "have got to", "must", and their negative forms.

video_title: Complex Sentences & Modal Verbs - Intermediate English with Mark #21
description: Mark teaches about writing complex sentences. Then, he discusses using modal verbs and phrases when expressing suggestions and giving advice.

video_title: Review of Modals #1 - Intermediate English with Mark #22
description: Mark reviews modal verbs of obligation and advice. Phrases and words covered include must, have to, have got to, should, had better, and ought to.

video_title: Review of Modal Verbs #2 - Intermediate English with Mark #23
description: Mark does a listening activity with the students as well as describes the grammar English speakers use to make requests.

video_title: How to Make Requests - Intermediate English with Mark #24
description: Mark goes over the special phrases and grammar we use in English to make and answer requests.

video_title: Future #1 - Intermediate English with Mark #25
description: Mark explains how English speakers use will when making decisions at the moment of speaking.

video_title: Future #2 - Intermediate English with Mark #26
description: Mark explains how to use be going to and the present continuous to describe future plans.

video_title: Future #3 - Intermediate English with Mark #27
description: In this grammar lesson, Mark explains how to make predictions about the future using be going to and will. Also, Mark explains how we use the present simple and present continuous to describe future events. Finally, Mark describes using may and might to predict the future with uncertainty.

video_title: Vocabulary - Intermediate English with Mark #28
description: In this lesson, Mark goes over vocabulary related to fashion.

video_title: Vocabulary  - Intermediate English with Mark #29
description: In this lesson, Mark goes over vocabulary related to fashion.

video_title: Reading - Intermediate English with Mark #30
description: Mark does a reading comprehension activity that goes over unit vocabulary and grammar about the future.

video_title: Making Comparisons - Intermediate English with Mark #31
description: In this grammar lesson, Mark goes over how to make comparative adjectives in English.

video_title: Present Perfect: Indefinite Past - Intermediate English with Shaun #40
description: In this lesson, students will learn to use the Present Perfect to describe finished past actions when not focusing on a specific past time. This includes describing finished events that have a relevance to the present and describing experience.

video_title: Listening and Present Perfect: How Long? - Intermediate English with Shaun #41
description: The class will do a listening warm-up activity and learn about the Present Perfect Continuous as the main way English speakers describe the duration of unfinished actions.

video_title: Vocabulary & Subject-Verb Agreement - Intermediate English with Shaun #42
description: The class will look at some key vocabulary from Unit 7 and examine common problems in student writing with subject-verb agreement.

video_title: Past Simple or Present Perfect? - Intermediate English with Shaun #43
description: In this lesson, we will clarify the main differences between the past simple and present perfect. Students also learn the basic rules of comma usage.

video_title: Commas - Intermediate English with Shaun #44
description: Students learn and practice rules for using commas.

video_title: Gerunds - Intermediate English with Shaun #45
description: Students study the three most common ways gerunds are used in sentences: as subjects, as objects, and objects of prepositions.

video_title: Gerunds and Vocabulary - Intermediate English with Shaun #46
description: We will continue looking at the common ways gerunds are used in sentences and will work on vocabulary

video_title: Infinitives and Gerunds - Intermediate English with Shaun #47
description: Students learn about verb patterns with infinitives and gerunds.

video_title: Sentence Fragments - Intermediate English with Shaun #48
description: Students learn how to identify and avoid sentence fragments in their writing.

video_title: Verb Patterns - Intermediate English with Shaun #49
description: Students practice using infinitives with and without objects.

video_title: First Conditionals and Time Clauses - Intermediate English with Shaun #50
description: Students practice describing the future with two-clause sentences.

video_title: Second Conditional - Intermediate English with Shaun #51
description: Students practice using the second conditional to describe hypothetical situations.

video_title: First or Second Conditional? - Intermediate English with Shaun #52
description: Students practice the difference between these two conditional structures.

video_title: Run-On Sentences and Comma Splices - Intermediate English with Shaun #53
description: Students learn how to identify and avoid run-on sentences and comma splices in their writing.

video_title: Modals of Certainty #1 - Intermediate English with Shaun #54
description: Students practice the usage of modals to describe the probability of present and future events.

video_title: Modals of Certainty #2 - Intermediate English with Shaun #55
description: Students practice how to speculate about the past using modal verbs.

video_title: Definite and Indefinite Articles - Intermediate English with Shaun #56
description: Students learn rules for proper use of articles and then apply these rules in an exercise

video_title: Definite and Indefinite Articles #2 - Intermediate English with Shaun #57
description: Students learn rules for proper use of articles and then apply these rules in an exercise

video_title: Linking Words: Cause & Effect - Intermediate English with Shaun #58
description: Students learn common linking devices that can be used to show a cause and effect relationship between ideas.

video_title: Indirect Questions - Intermediate English with Shaun #59
description: Students learn and practice the differences between direct and indirect questions.

video_title: Indirect Questions #2 - Intermediate English with Shaun #60
description: Students learn and practice the differences between direct and indirect questions.

video_title: Tag Questions - Intermediate English with Shaun #61
description: Students learn the two kinds of questions tags and how they are formed.

video_title: Phrasal Verbs #1 (In, Out, Away and Back) - Intermediate English with Shaun #62
description: Students learn common phrasal verbs with in, out, away and back as well as the basic rules for using phrasal verbs.

video_title: Reported Speech #1 - Intermediate English with Shaun #63
description: Students learn and practice the differences between direct and reported speech.

video_title: Reported Speech #2 - Intermediate English with Shaun #64
description: Students learn and practice the differences between direct and reported speech.

video_title: Advanced English lesson - Focus adverbs - ingl√©s B2 - C1
description:
This is an Advanced English lesson about focus adverbs for B2/C1 level learners and for people that want to perfect their speaking and writing skills in English. It is also good for people preparing IELTS, or another similar type English exam. 
Some common focus adverbs include: generally, largely, only, just, especially, etc, and they are used to give emphasis to specific parts of a sentence when we write or speak English. It is just the English lesson you need to be watching!

video_title: English grammar lesson B2 - Future perfect tense - Gram√°tica inglesa
description: Improve your English fluency with this grammar video on how we use the future perfect tense in English.

video_title: English grammar lesson B2 - Comparative structures - Gram√°tica en ingl√©s
description: An English grammar lesson on how we use some of the more advanced comparative structures in English. Perfect for learners looking to improve their fluency in English and perfect their use of grammar.

video_title: Using besides, except and apart from in English
description: This is an English lesson on how we use besides, except (for) and apart from in English. It is for more advanced students B1+ who are looking to perfect their English and knowledge of English grammar structures.

video_title: English lesson B1+/B2 - Using "as", "since", "because" and "for" to show reason in English
description: In this English lesson you will see how we use 'as', 'since', 'because' and 'for' to show reason in English. For example: Since you forgot to pick me up, I had to walk to work.

video_title: English grammar lesson B2 - position of adverbs - Gram√°tica inglesa
description:
Adverbs can take different positions in sentences. In this English grammar lesson you will learn which positions adverbs can take.

Some examples:
Personally, I prefer wine to beer. (Front)
I finally went to the doctor. (Mid)
She is driving very fast.  (End)

video_title: English vocabulary lesson B2 - Immigration - Vocabulario en ingl√©s
description: In this English lesson we look at some of the vocabulary we use when we talk about immigration in English.

video_title: English lesson - Verbs to talk about CHANGE - Gram√°tica inglesa
description:
In this English lesson you will learn the verbs 'become', 'get', 'come', 'go', 'turn' and 'grow', to talk about changes in English. For example:
It's getting dark. 
I go red when embarrassed.
The night is turning ugly.

video_title: English grammar - Causative verbs GET and HAVE - gram√°tica inglesa
description: In this English grammar lesson you will learn how we use the causative verbs GET and Have in English. For example, to have something done. or get somebody to do something.

video_title: English grammar - UNREAL PAST (if, if only, wish, it's time) - gram√°tica inglesa
description: In this English grammar lesson you will learn how we use the UNREAL PAST - past tenses used after WISH, IF ONLY, IF, WOULD RATHER, IT'S TIME... to talk about present or future situations that are unreal or impossible.

video_title: English expressions with TAKE - usar 'take' en ingl√©s
description: In this English lesson you will learn some common English expressions with the verb 'take'.

video_title: English grammar - Conditional sentences without 'if' - condicionales ingl√©s
description: In this English lesson you will learn how we use conditional sentences without using the 'if' clause.

video_title: English grammar - How to use HAD BETTER  - gram√°tica inglesa
description: In this English lesson you will learn how we use HAD BETTER in English.

video_title: English lesson: Transition words and phrases - ADDITION - palabras de transici√≥n
description: In this English lesson you will learn how we use transition words and phrases for ADDITION to help you perfect your English and speak and write more fluently.

video_title: English lesson - Commonly confused words - palabras en ingl√©s
description: In this lesson I show you some of most confusing words in English and how to use them correctly. Some of the most common words people confuse are lie and lay, loose and lose, and their, there and they're.

video_title: English grammar - Participle clauses with the Perfect participle  - gram√°tica inglesa
description: In this lesson you will learn how we use the perfect participle in participle clauses to emphasise and show result.

video_title: English lesson - Confusing verbs - Ingl√©s B2
description: In this English lesson we look at some of the more confusing verbs in English and how NOT to confuse them any longer.

video_title: English lesson -  Idioms and phrases with the words SET - frases en ingl√©s
description: In  this English lesson you will learn some idioms and phrases with the verb SET.

video_title: English grammar -Inversion - gram√°tica inglesa
description: In this English lesson you will learn how and when we use INVERSION in English, in conditional sentences, after no sooner, barely, rarely, etc.

video_title: English lesson - Words for describing people - palabras en ingl√©s
description: In this English lesson you will learn some words we use in English for describing people, for example, courageous, down-to-earth gullible, and more.

video_title: English lesson - Prepositional phrases with OUT OF - frases preposicionales
description: In this English lesson you will learn some prepositional phrases with 'out 'of', like out of order, out of earshot, out of print, and more.

video_title: English lesson - Positive adjectives for describing things - ingl√©s b2
description: In this English lesson you will learn some positive adjectives for describing things in English, such as absorbing, breathtaking and delightful.

video_title: English lesson - Idioms with body parts
description: In this English lesson you will learn some English idiomas that feature body parts. For example, to bite your tongue, or to be all ears.

video_title: English lesson - Pronunciation of LOANWORDS - extranjerismos en ingl√©s
description: In this English lesson you will see some of the most popular loanwords, or borrowed words, in English and how they are pronounced.

video_title: English lesson - Sentence connectors - conectores en ingl√©s
description: In this English lesson you will see how we use some common connectors in English to help you speak and write English more fluently.

video_title: English lesson - Idioms with KEEP - ingl√©s B2
description: In this English lesson you will learn some of the more common idioms with the verb KEEP.

video_title: News English lesson - Rundown Havana and Argentine cuts
description: In this English lesson we look at some current events and the vocabulary and expressions used to help you improve your understanding of English.

video_title: English lesson - Words to talk about being RICH or BROKE
description: In this English lesson you will learn some of the main words and expressions when we talk about being RICH or BROKE.

video_title: English lesson - Expressions with TURN
description: In today's English lesson you will learn some of the main expression we use in English with the verb TURN.

video_title: English lesson - Expressions with RIGHT
description: In this English lesson you will learn some expressions that use the word RIGHT, like right as rain, to serve someone right, to be in the right, and more.

video_title: English news lesson - Clinton v Trump, Aussie moon protest
description: In this English lesson we look at some current events and the vocabulary and expressions used to help you improve your understanding of English.

video_title: English lesson - Sports idioms
description: In this English lesson you will learn some of the common sports idioms that we have in English such as 'plain sailing', 'to be stumped', 'level playing field' and more.

video_title: English lesson - Discourse markers to change the topic
description: In this English lesson you will see how we use the discourse markers 'by the way', 'incidentally', 'speaking of' and 'that reminds me' when we want to change our topic of conversation.

video_title: English lesson - Complex sentences using ADVERB CLAUSES and phrases of time
description: In this English lesson you will see how we form more complex sentences in English using adverb clauses and phrases of time.

video_title: English lesson - MONEY and FINANCE idioms
description: In this English lesson you will learn some common MONEY and FINANCE idioms.

video_title: English lesson - Using COMPOUND ADJECTIVES
description: In this English lesson you will learn and see how we use some difficult COMPOUND ADJECTIVES in English.

video_title: English lesson - How to use the definite article (the) - gram√°tica inglesa
description: In this English lesson you will practise when to use and when not to use the definite article (the).

video_title: English lesson - How to talk about personal finance
description: IN this English lesson you will learn how to talk about personal finance in English.

video_title: English lesson - Other ways to use the INFINITIVE
description: In this English grammar lesson you will learn some other ways to use the infinitive in English.

video_title: English lesson: Talking about PROBLEMS and DIFFICULTIES
description: In this lesson you will learn different words and expressions to talk about problems and difficulties in English. A great lesson if you want to build your English vocabulary.

video_title: English lesson  - Phrasal verbs with PAY
description: In this English lesson you will how to use the main phrasal verbs with the the verb 'PAY'.

video_title: English lesson - Words to talk about INVESTING MONEY
description: In this English lesson you will learn some of the words and expressions we use when we talk about INVESTING MONEY.

description: In this English lesson you will learn how we use linking phrases, or conjunctions like 'so as to' and in order to' to join a main clause with a subordinate clause.

description: In this English lesson you will learn the key vocabulary we use in English when we talk about employment.

description: In this English lesson you will learn how we use the adverbs HARDLY, SCARCELY & BARELY in English.

description: In this English lesson you will learn the ket words and expressions we use in English to talk about EARNING MONEY.

video_title: English learning video - Words and expressions about PAYING MONEY
description: In today's English learning video we look and words and expressions we use in English when we talk about PAYING MONEY. The lesson is aimed at B2 - C1 level English learners.

video_title: English learning video - Sentence correction
description: In this English learning video you will see 10 sentences with grammar mistakes. Do you know what the mistakes are? Sentence correction is a great way to learn English and it helps you write and speak perfect English sentences.

video_title: Learn English - Words to talk about Honesty and Sincerity
description: Learn and improve your English with this English lesson on words and expressions we use when we talk about Honesty and Sincerity. English for level b2.

video_title: English lesson - Contrast links
description: In this English lesson you will learn how we use contrast links like while, whereas, on the one hand, on the other hand, etc. to contract facts or ideas in Englsih.

description: In this English lesson you will learn some of the main words and expressions we use in English when we talk about Arguing and Disagreeing.

description: In this English lesson for B2 and C1 level learners you will learn some advanced compound adjectives that we frequently use in English.

description: In today's English lesson for B2/C1 level students you will learn some of the main verbs that are followed by the preposition TOWARDS.
